gurmukhi: Qwr cwr Apwr kuMkm cMdnwid AnMq ]
transliteration: Thaar Chaar Apaar Kounkam Channdanaadh Anant||
translation: Four adorned slavers containing saffron, sandalwood etc.,

gurmukhi: rwj swj Dry sBY qh Awn Awn durMq ]
transliteration: Raaj Saaj Ddare Sabhai Tah Aan Aan Durant||
translation: Were kept with the king for the fulfillment of this function.

gurmukhi: mMQrw iek gwNDRbI bHmw pTI iqh kwl ]
translation: At the same time Brahma sent a Gandharva woman named Manthra to the place,

gurmukhi: bwj swj sxY cVI sB suBR Daul auqwl ]198]
transliteration: Baaj Saaj Sanai Chadibaad Soune Rahichak Baal||
translation: Who embellished with all kinds of arts and wearing white garments started very quickly.198.

gurmukhi: byx bIx mRdMg bwd suxy rhI ck bwl ]
transliteration: Ben Been Mradan Baad Soune Rahichak Baal||
translation: She was surprised to listen to the sound of lyre, drum and other musical instruments,

gurmukhi: rwmrwj auTI jXq Duin BUm BUr ibswl ]
transliteration: Raamraaj Outhijahat Dhoun(i) Bhoom Bhoor Bidaal||
translation: And also saw on that wide plain the sound hailing the victory of ram Rajya was being heard.

gurmukhi: jwq hI sMig kykeI ieh BwNq bolI bwiq ]
transliteration: Jaat Hisan(i) Kakai Eh Bhaant Bolibaat(i)||
translation: Going near Kaikeyi she addressed her in this way :

gurmukhi: hwQ bwq CutI clI br mwNg hYN ikh rwiq ]199]
transliteration: Haath Baat Chhoutichalibar Maan Hain Kih Raat(i)||199||
translation: “When the opportunity will go out of hand, then for whom you will ask for the boons?”199.

gurmukhi: kykeI iem jau sunI BeI du`Kqw srbMg ]
translation: When Kaikeye heard all the account, she was completely full of anguish,

gurmukhi: JUm BUm igrI miRgI ijm lwg bx surMg ]
transliteration: Jhoom Bhoom Girimrigijim Laag Baan Suran||
translation: And fell down unconscious on the earth like the doe pierced by an arrow.

gurmukhi: jwq hI AvDys k`au ieh BwNiq bolI bYn ]
transliteration: Jaat Hiavadhes Kau Eh Bhaant(i) Bolibain||
translation: Going in the presence of king of Oudh, she said this :

gurmukhi: dIjIey br BUp mokau jo khy duie dYn ]200]
transliteration: Deejeee Bar Bhoop Mokau Jo Kahe Due Dain||200||
translation: “O king ! You had promised to grant me two boons, grant them to me just now.200.

gurmukhi: rwm ko bn dIjIAY mm pUq kau inj rwj ]
transliteration: Raam Ko Ban Deejeeai Mam Poot Kau Nij Raaj||
translation: “Give exile to Ram and your kingdom, wealth, whisk an canopy-everything.

gurmukhi: rwj swj su sMpdw doaU caur C`qR smwj ]
transliteration: Raaj Saaj Su Sanpadaa Dooo Chaur Chhattra Samaaj||
translation: " Give him ( Bharat) the kingdom, wealth, whisk and canopy-everything
